DOC.brief_summary: This study use CBPR mixed method ( qualitative quantitative data collection ) conduct need assessment design evaluate core family-based intervention . Project activity emphasize capacity building two refugee community resettle Greater Boston—the Somali Bantu Bhutanese—actively engage refugee community member , community advisory board , service provider , stakeholder . Specific Aims : ( 1 ) deepen partnership Somali Bantu Bhutanese communities co-leadership , capacity-building , knowledge sharing ; ( 2 ) collect apply qualitative data ( ) prepare need assessment mental health child adolescent , barrier care , service preference target refugee group ; ( b ) develop mental health/psychosocial assessment refugee caregiver child ; ( c ) adapt core component family-based strengthen intervention use refugee ; ( 3 ) conduct 80-family pilot study examine acceptability sustainability intervention . Key outcomes reduce mental health symptom among child adolescent improvement caregiver-child relationship .
DOC.brief_title: Addressing Mental Health Disparities Refugee Children : A Community-based Participatory Research ( CBPR ) Collaboration
DOC.criteria: Refugee family must schoolaged child ( aged 517 ) , caregiver must least 18 year age live household child . Untreated mental illness active family crisis
